message.content:
cs.IR, cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.DS 

This paper proposes a framework for discriminative Information Retrieval (IR) using linguistic features to improve recall in text-based Question Answering (QA). The paper formalizes this as an instance of linear feature-based IR, which is a common approach in the field of Information Retrieval (IR). Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-category for this paper is cs.IR (Information Retrieval). Additionally, the paper also deals with natural language processing (NLP) and machine learning (ML) techniques, which are covered in sub-categories such as cs.CL (Computation and Language) and cs.LG (Machine Learning). The paper also involves knowledge discovery tasks, which are covered in sub-categories such as cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms).
